steps.title: Prepare the Chicken
steps.instruction: Rinse the chicken and pat dry. Rub with salt and let it sit for 15 minutes. This helps to firm up the skin and remove any gamey smell.
steps.tip: Make sure the chicken is at room temperature before cooking for even results.

steps.title: Poach the Chicken
steps.instruction: In a large pot, bring water to boil with ginger slices and salt. Gently lower the chicken and simmer for 20-25 minutes until fully cooked.
steps.tip: Keep the water at a gentle simmer, not a rolling boil, to keep the chicken tender.

steps.title: Prepare Chicken Rice
steps.instruction: Heat oil in a pan, fry minced garlic and ginger until fragrant. Add rice and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add chicken stock and cook until rice is done.
steps.tip: Use the chicken poaching liquid as stock for extra flavor.

steps.title: Make the Sauce
steps.instruction: Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and minced ginger. Adjust taste with sugar and salt. This is your dipping sauce for the chicken.
steps.tip: Let the sauce sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld together.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.instruction: Slice the chicken and arrange on plates. Serve with fragrant rice, cucumber slices, and the prepared sauce on the side.
steps.tip: Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve immediately while everything is still warm.

steps.title: Prepare Ingredients
steps.instruction: Cut chicken into bite-sized cubes. Dice bell peppers and slice green onions. Toast peanuts in a dry pan until fragrant.
steps.tip: Keep all ingredients ready as stir-frying happens very quickly.

steps.title: Marinate Chicken
steps.instruction: Mix chicken with soy sauce, cornstarch, and a pinch of salt. Let marinate for 10 minutes.
steps.tip: Cornstarch helps create a tender texture and crispy exterior.

steps.title: Stir-Fry Chicken
steps.instruction: Heat oil in wok over high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until golden brown and cooked through, about 5-6 minutes.
steps.tip: Don't overcrowd the pan - cook in batches if necessary.

steps.title: Add Vegetables and Sauce
steps.instruction: Add bell peppers, dried chilies, and peanuts. Pour in the kung pao sauce and toss everything together for 2 minutes.
steps.tip: Be careful with the chilies - adjust amount based on your spice tolerance.

steps.title: Finish and Serve
steps.instruction: Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds. Serve immediately with steamed rice.
steps.tip: Serve immediately while everything is hot and crispy.

steps.title: Prepare Duck Breast
steps.instruction: Score the duck skin in a crosshatch pattern, being careful not to cut into the meat. Season with salt and pepper on both sides.
steps.tip: Scoring the skin helps render the fat and creates a crispy texture.

steps.title: Sear the Duck
steps.instruction: Place duck skin-side down in a cold pan. Cook over medium heat for 8-10 minutes until skin is golden and crispy.
steps.tip: Starting with a cold pan helps render the fat slowly for maximum crispiness.

steps.title: Flip and Continue Cooking
steps.instruction: Flip duck breast and cook for another 3-4 minutes for medium-rare. Adjust time based on your preference.
steps.tip: Use a meat thermometer - 135°F for medium-rare, 145°F for medium.

steps.title: Make Honey Glaze
steps.instruction: In the same pan, add honey, soy sauce, and orange juice. Simmer until thickened and glossy.
steps.tip: The glaze should coat the back of a spoon when ready.

steps.title: Rest and Serve
steps.instruction: Let duck rest for 5 minutes, then slice and drizzle with honey glaze. Garnish with fresh thyme.
steps.tip: Resting allows juices to redistribute for a more tender result.

steps.title: Prepare the Fish
steps.instruction: Clean the fish fillet and pat dry. Score the skin lightly and season with salt. Let it rest for 10 minutes.
steps.tip: Fresh fish should smell like the ocean, not 'fishy'. Choose the freshest available.

steps.title: Prepare Aromatics
steps.instruction: Julienne ginger into thin strips. Cut scallions into 2-inch lengths, separating white and green parts.
steps.tip: Younger ginger is less fibrous and has a milder flavor - perfect for steaming.

steps.title: Steam the Fish
steps.instruction: Place fish on a heatproof plate with half the ginger strips on top. Steam over boiling water for 8-12 minutes depending on thickness.
steps.tip: Fish is done when it flakes easily with a fork but is still moist.

steps.title: Prepare the Sauce
steps.instruction: Heat oil in a small pan. Add remaining ginger and white parts of scallions. Pour in soy sauce and heat through.
steps.tip: The hot oil will create a sizzling effect when poured over the fish.

steps.title: Finish and Serve
steps.instruction: Discard steaming liquid. Pour hot sauce over fish and garnish with green scallions. Serve immediately.
steps.tip: Serve immediately while the fish is hot and the sauce is sizzling.

steps.title: Prepare the Crab
steps.instruction: Clean live crabs and chop into pieces. Crack claws and legs lightly to allow sauce to penetrate.
steps.tip: Keep crabs cold and handle carefully. Use a heavy cleaver for clean cuts.

steps.title: Make Chili Sauce
steps.instruction: Blend tomato sauce, chili sauce, rice vinegar, and sugar. Beat eggs lightly in a separate bowl.
steps.tip: Adjust sweetness and spice level to your preference before cooking.

steps.title: Stir-Fry Crab
steps.instruction: Heat oil in a large wok. Add crab pieces and stir-fry over high heat for 3-4 minutes until shells turn red.
steps.tip: The wok should be very hot to create the characteristic 'wok hei' flavor.

steps.title: Add Sauce
steps.instruction: Pour in the chili sauce mixture and toss to coat all crab pieces. Cook for 5-6 minutes until sauce thickens.
steps.tip: Keep stirring to prevent sauce from burning and ensure even coating.

steps.title: Add Egg and Serve
steps.instruction: Slowly drizzle beaten eggs while stirring constantly. Garnish with cilantro and serve with mantou bread.
steps.tip: The eggs should form silky ribbons throughout the sauce.

steps.title: Prepare Prawns
steps.instruction: Peel and devein prawns, leaving tails on. Pat dry and season lightly with salt and pepper.
steps.tip: Don't over-season as the garlic butter will add plenty of flavor.

steps.title: Prepare Garlic
steps.instruction: Mince garlic finely and chop fresh parsley. Have white wine ready for deglazing.
steps.tip: Fresh garlic is essential - avoid pre-minced for the best flavor.

steps.title: Sear the Prawns
steps.instruction: Heat olive oil in a large pan over high heat. Add prawns and cook for 1-2 minutes per side until pink.
steps.tip: Don't overcook prawns as they'll become tough and rubbery.

steps.title: Add Garlic and Butter
steps.instruction: Add minced garlic and butter to the pan. Toss prawns to coat and cook for another minute until fragrant.
steps.tip: Watch the garlic carefully - it should be golden, not brown.

steps.title: Finish and Serve
steps.instruction: Deglaze with white wine, add parsley, and toss. Serve immediately with crusty bread.
steps.tip: Serve with bread to soak up the delicious garlic butter sauce.

steps.title: Prepare the Lamb
steps.instruction: Slice lamb against the grain into thin strips. Marinate with soy sauce, cornstarch, and oil for 15 minutes.
steps.tip: Slicing against the grain ensures tender meat that's easy to chew.

steps.title: Prepare Vegetables
steps.instruction: Slice onions into thick strips and cut scallions into 2-inch pieces, separating white and green parts.
steps.tip: Keep onion pieces large so they don't overcook and turn mushy.

steps.title: Stir-Fry Lamb
steps.instruction: Heat oil in wok over high heat. Add lamb and stir-fry quickly for 2-3 minutes until just cooked through.
steps.tip: Work in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding the wok.

steps.title: Add Onions and Sauce
steps.instruction: Add onions and white parts of scallions. Stir-fry for 2 minutes, then add hoisin sauce mixture.
steps.tip: The onions should still have some crunch for the best texture.

steps.title: Finish and Serve
steps.instruction: Add green parts of scallions and toss everything together. Serve immediately over steamed rice.
steps.tip: The dish should have a glossy sauce that coats all ingredients.

steps.title: Prepare the Beef
steps.instruction: Cut beef into thin strips against the grain. Marinate with soy sauce, cornstarch, and a little oil for 20 minutes.
steps.tip: Freezing beef for 30 minutes before slicing makes it easier to cut thin strips.

steps.title: Prepare Vegetables
steps.instruction: Cut bell peppers into strips and slice onions. Crush black peppercorns coarsely for maximum flavor.
steps.tip: Use a mix of colored bell peppers for a more visually appealing dish.

steps.title: Stir-Fry Beef
steps.instruction: Heat oil in wok over high heat. Add beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until just cooked. Remove and set aside.
steps.tip: Don't overcook the beef or it will become tough and chewy.

steps.title: Stir-Fry Vegetables
steps.instruction: In the same wok, add vegetables and black pepper. Stir-fry for 2 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
steps.tip: The vegetables should retain some crunch for the best texture contrast.

steps.title: Combine and Serve
steps.instruction: Return beef to wok, add sauce, and toss everything together. Serve immediately with rice.
steps.tip: The sauce should coat everything without being too thick or watery.

steps.title: Prepare Tofu
steps.instruction: Cut silky tofu into 1-inch cubes. Soak in warm salted water for 10 minutes to firm up slightly.
steps.tip: Handle tofu gently to prevent breaking. Salted water helps maintain shape during cooking.

steps.title: Cook Ground Pork
steps.instruction: Heat oil in wok and cook ground pork until crispy and golden. Add doubanjiang and cook until fragrant.
steps.tip: Let the pork get really crispy for the best texture contrast with the soft tofu.

steps.title: Add Seasonings
steps.instruction: Add garlic, ginger, and fermented black beans. Stir-fry for 1 minute until aromatic.
steps.tip: Don't let the garlic burn or it will become bitter.

steps.title: Add Tofu and Sauce
steps.instruction: Gently add tofu cubes and pour in the sauce. Simmer for 3-4 minutes, shaking the pan gently to coat tofu.
steps.tip: Don't stir too vigorously to keep the tofu pieces intact.

steps.title: Finish and Serve
steps.instruction: Sprinkle with Sichuan peppercorns and chopped scallions. Serve immediately with steamed rice.
steps.tip: The Sichuan peppercorns provide the characteristic numbing sensation.

steps.title: Prepare Vegetables
steps.instruction: Cut all vegetables into uniform pieces. Start with harder vegetables like carrots and potatoes first.
steps.tip: Uniform sizing ensures even cooking times for all vegetables.

steps.title: Toast Spices
steps.instruction: In a large pot, toast curry paste and whole spices until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
steps.tip: Toasting spices releases their essential oils and deepens the flavor.

steps.title: Add Coconut Milk
steps.instruction: Pour in coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Add harder vegetables first and cook for 10 minutes.
steps.tip: Don't let the coconut milk boil vigorously or it may curdle.

steps.title: Add Remaining Vegetables
steps.instruction: Add softer vegetables and cook for another 8-10 minutes until all vegetables are tender.
steps.tip: Add delicate vegetables like leafy greens in the last few minutes.

steps.title: Season and Serve
steps.instruction: Adjust seasoning with salt and lime juice. Garnish with fresh herbs and serve with rice or bread.
steps.tip: A squeeze of lime juice brightens all the flavors at the end.

steps.title: Prepare Ingredients
steps.instruction: Organize all ingredients according to the provided ingredient list. Wash vegetables and prepare proteins as needed.
steps.tip: Having everything ready before cooking makes the process much smoother.

steps.title: Follow Kit Instructions
steps.instruction: Each meal kit comes with detailed step-by-step instructions. Follow them carefully for the best results.
steps.tip: Don't skip steps - each one is designed to build flavors properly.

steps.title: Cook with Care
steps.instruction: Pay attention to cooking times and temperatures. Taste and adjust seasonings as you go.
steps.tip: Trust your senses - look, smell, and taste to judge doneness.

steps.title: Plate and Enjoy
steps.instruction: Present your dish attractively and serve while hot. Enjoy the fruits of your labor!
steps.tip: A beautiful presentation enhances the dining experience.
